intro: Stilbe virgata, commonly known as the slender bellflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Campanulaceae family. It is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in a fine, fuzzy layer. Stilbe virgata is often found in temperate regions of Europe and Asia, where it thrives in cool, humid climates.
